If there are multiple results, please indicate them as XXX-XXX.

of the MOL-derived L-NiC and L-CoC are better than the MOF-derived F-NiC and F-CoC, which may be ascribed to the increased exposure of Ni and Co in L-NiC and L-CoC.To evaluate the reusable capacity, we collect the used catalysts and disperse them into fresh reaction solutions.The gas generation rates of CO and H 2 are stable after three repeated experiments (Figure 8d).The structural stability of the L-NiC sample is analyzed.There is no change in the XRD pattern after the photocatalytic reaction (Figure

photocatalytic reaction (Figure S9).The TEM image of the L-NiC sample after photocatalysis shows the highly dispersive NiC nanoparticles still, and the (111) crystal planes of metallic Ni with an interplanar spacing of 0.202 nm can be identified from the HRTEM image (Figure S10).The above results demonstrate the excellent stability and reusability of the magnetic MOL-derived catalysts. A series of photoelectrochemical tests are conducted to reveal the origin of the better catalytic activities of the L-NiC

CO 2 reduction.The as-prepared Ni-MOLs and Co-MOLs have an ultrathin thickness of 1 nm.It is interestingly found that their derived NiC and CoC nanoparticles are highly dispersive and connected with each other like a piece of paper.As compared with bulk MOF-derived counterparts, MOL-derived catalysts increase the accessibility of active metal sites, which can accelerate electron transfer from photosensitizers to NiC and CoC nanoparticles.In this way, the catalytic activity can be greatly improved.Besides,

the active metal sites in the MOL-derived samples are more accessible than those in the MOF-derived samples.To highlight the advantage of such special MOLderived NiC and CoC nanoparticles, photocatalytic CO 2 reduction is then performed to evaluate the catalytic activity. The photocatalytic CO 2 reduction uses Ru(bpy) 3 Cl 2 6H 2 O (abbreviated as Ru, bpy 2,2-bipyridine) as a photosensitizer and an electron donor and triethanolamine (TEOA) as a hole scavenger.As shown in Figure 7a,b, the main reduction

Please find the category of Light_source and Lamp from the provided context which describe an solar chemical experiment.
The generation condition of the extraction is given: If Light_source is Solar or Solar Simulator, Lamp is always Solar Simulator.

evidence.pdf_reference: experiment was performed under a 13 CO 2 atmosphere.Then, the gas products were analyzed by gas chromatography-mass spectrometry (GC-MS, Agilent 7890B and Agilent 5977B MSD). 2.7.Photoelectrochemical Measurements.The photoelectrochemical measurement was performed using a standard threeelectrode quartz cell.Fluorine-doped tin oxide glass that was coated with the photocatalysts (the coating area of 0.5 cm 2 ) served as the working electrodes.Pt and AgAgCl were used as counter and reference electrodes,

to evaluate the separation of electronhole pairs and their recombination.PL spectra obtained under an excitation wavelength of 520 nm are shown in Figure 9c,d.In the absence of catalysts, the photosensitizer Ru itself displays a strong emission at 608 nm due to a serious recombination of electrons and holes.The introduction of catalysts leads to luminescence quenching.The intensities of emission peaks decrease for all samples, indicating that the carrier recombination is greatly inhibited.Furthermore, the

and reference electrodes, respectively.The transient photocurrent response is measured on an electrochemical analyzer (CH Instruments CHI660E) under irradiation with a xenon lamp.The mixed solvent of CH 3 CNH 2 OTEOA containing Ru(bpy) 3 Cl 2 6H 2 O was used as the electrolyte.Electrochemical impedance spectra was measured on an electrochemical workstation (Princeton PARSTAT MC).The mixed aqueous solution of K 3 Fe(CN) 6 (5 mM), K 4 Fe(CN) 6 (5 mM), and KCl (0.1 mM) was used as the electrolyte.

of CH 3 CNH 2 OTEOA 3:2:1 (volvol).The reaction system was vacuum degassed and purged with CO 2 three times, alternately.Then, the quartz reactor was purged with CO 2 again for 30 min.The reaction system was irradiated under a 300 W xenon lamp with a 420 nm cutoff filter.The temperature was controlled at 301-303 K by circulating cooling water and heating.The gas products were analyzed by gas chromatography (Agilent 7890B).To confirm the carbon source of CO, the 13 CO 2 isotopic experiment was performed

were measured at 273 K on a physisorption system (Micromeritics, ASAP 2020).Photoluminescence spectroscopy was measured in a mixed solution of CH 3 CN (3 mL), H 2 O (2 mL), and TEOA (1 mL) containing Ru(bpy) 3 Cl 2 6H 2 O (8 mg) and samples (1 mg) on a spectrophotometer (HORIBA, FluoroMax-4). 2.6.Photocatalytic CO 2 Reduction.The photocatalytic CO2 reduction was performed in a quartz reactor.The catalysts (1 mg) and Ru(bpy) 3 Cl 2 6H 2 O (8 mg) were dispersed in the mixed solvent of CH 3 CNH 2 OTEOA 3:2:1
